TypeSignature.Value: public interface ISSLSession : Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable
.class public interface auto ansi abstract ISSLSession implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type ISSLSession = interface interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: In SSL, sessions are used to describe an ongoing relationship between two entities.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the maximum size that an application buffer can be for this session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the name of the cipher suite used in this session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the time this session was created, in milliseconds since midnight January 1st 1970 UTC.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetId() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the identifier assigned to this Session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Security.Cert.Certificate[] GetLocalCertificates() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the certificate(s) that were sent to the peer during handshaking.
Docs.returns: an ordered array of certificates, with the local certificate first followed by any certificate authorities. If no certificates were sent, then null is returned.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Javax.Security.Cert.X509Certificate[] GetPeerCertificateChain() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the identity of the peer which was identified as part of defining the session.
Docs.returns: an ordered array of peer X.509 certificates, with the peer's own certificate first followed by any certificate authorities. (The certificates are in the original JSSE certificate javax.security.cert.X509Certificate format.)

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the identity of the peer is not verified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Security.Cert.Certificate[] GetPeerCertificates() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the identity of the peer which was established as part of defining the session.
Docs.returns: an ordered array of peer certificates, with the peer's own certificate first followed by any certificate authorities.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the identity of the peer is not verified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.Object GetValue(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: the name of the binding to find.
Docs.summary: Returns the object bound to the given name in the session's application layer data.
Docs.returns: the value bound to that name, or null if the binding does not exist.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] GetValueNames() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of the names of all the application layer data objects bound into the Session.
Docs.returns: a non-null (possibly empty) array of names of the objects bound to this Session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Invalidate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Invalidates the session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns whether this session is valid.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the time this session was last accessed, in milliseconds since midnight January 1st 1970 UTC.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the principal used to identify the local side to the peer during the handshake.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the maximum size that a network buffer can be for this session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the host name of the peer of this session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the port number of the peer of this session.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the principal identifying the peer during the handshake.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the identity of the peer has not been verified.

Docs.summary: Returns the protocol name that is used for all connections in this session.

Docs.param: the name to which the data object will be bound. This may not be null.
the data object to be bound. This may not be null.
Docs.summary: Binds the specified value object into the session's application layer data with the given name.

Docs.exception: if either name or value is null.

Docs.param: the name of the object to remove visible across different access control contexts
Docs.summary: Removes the object bound to the given name in the session's application layer data.

Docs.summary: Returns the context of this session, or null if no context is available.
